alert.note: Alert for Merced - Madera - Mendota (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 18 at 3:20PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WESTERN MADERA AND CENTRAL MERCED COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM PST... At 319 PM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Merced, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Madera and central Merced Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
